org.mule.modules.openidconnect

Class OpenIDConnectConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.mule.modules.openidconnect.OpenIDConnectConnector
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    OpenIDConnectConnectorCapabilitiesAdapter

    @Connector(name="open-id-connect",
           friendlyName="OpenID Connect",
           minMuleVersion="3.6.1",
           description="OpenID Connect Module")
public class OpenIDConnectConnector
extends java.lang.Object
    This connector is used to filter invalid requests by validating bearer tokens obtained from the http 'Authorization' header or to act as an OpenID Connect relying party. You can choose between local token validation and online token validation by token introspection. Online means you have to configure the introspection endpoint of your identity provider. Tokens will then be validated via the http introspection endpoint. Validates issuer, if token is active and verifies the signature. If the connector acts as relying party, you will need an id and a secret for this client, registered at the identity provider.
    Author:
    Moritz MÃ¶ller, AOE GmbH

      • onlineTokenValidation

        @Processor
public void onlineTokenValidation(org.mule.api.MuleEvent muleEvent,
                                              @Default(value="#[message.inboundProperties.\'Authorization\']")
                                              java.lang.String tokenHeader,
                                              java.lang.String introspectionEndpoint,
                                              @FriendlyName(value="Client ID")
                                              java.lang.String clientId,
                                              @Password
                                              java.lang.String clientSecret,
                                              @Default(value="false")
                                              boolean claimExtraction)
                                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Uses token introspection specified by OAUTH 2.0 to validate the token. It calls an api endpoint at the sso with the given bearer token from the request header. Throws exception handled by ExceptionHandler if token isn't valid or if there are connection problems with the sso, otherwise it continues processing. If claim extraction is activated, set of id-token claims is added to the flow variables.
        Parameters:
        muleEvent - injected by devkit
        tokenHeader - Header with token to be validated ('Bearer TOKEN_STRING')
        introspectionEndpoint - The path of the introspection endpoint
        clientId - Any Client-ID from the SSO to prevent token scanning attacks
        clientSecret - The Secret of the given Client-ID
        claimExtraction - Creates the FlowVar tokenClaims which contains a map with all claims of the given token
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • onlineTokenValidationWithUserId

        @Processor
public void onlineTokenValidationWithUserId(org.mule.api.MuleEvent muleEvent,
                                                        @Default(value="#[message.inboundProperties.\'Authorization\']")
                                                        java.lang.String tokenHeader,
                                                        java.lang.String introspectionEndpoint,
                                                        java.lang.String userId,
                                                        @FriendlyName(value="Client ID")
                                                        java.lang.String clientId,
                                                        @Password
                                                        java.lang.String clientSecret,
                                                        @Default(value="false")
                                                        boolean claimExtraction)
                                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Uses token introspection specified by OAUTH 2.0 to validate the token. It calls an api endpoint at the sso with the given bearer token from the request header. If token is valid the connector checks if the userId from the token matches given userId. Throws exception handled by ExceptionHandler if token isn't valid or if there are connection problems with the sso, otherwise it continues processing. If claim extraction is activated, set of id-token claims is added to the flow variables.
        Parameters:
        muleEvent - injected by devkit
        tokenHeader - Header with token to be validated ('Bearer TOKEN_STRING')
        introspectionEndpoint - The path of the introspection endpoint
        userId - ID of the user the token was issued to
        clientId - Any Client-ID from the SSO to prevent token scanning attacks
        clientSecret - The Secret of the given Client-ID
        claimExtraction - Creates the FlowVar tokenClaims which contains a map with all claims of the given token
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • localTokenValidation

        @Processor
public void localTokenValidation(org.mule.api.MuleEvent muleEvent,
                                             @Default(value="#[message.inboundProperties.\'Authorization\']")
                                             java.lang.String tokenHeader,
                                             @Default(value="false")
                                             boolean claimExtraction)
                                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Uses a internal class to validate the token. Throws an exception handled by ExceptionHandler if validation fails. If claim extraction is activated, set of id-token claims is added to the flow variables.
        Parameters:
        muleEvent - The current MuleEvent Injected by the devkit
        tokenHeader - Header with token to be validated ('Bearer TOKEN_STRING')
        claimExtraction - Creates the FlowVar tokenClaims which contains a map with all claims of the given token
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • localTokenValidationWithUserId

        @Processor
public void localTokenValidationWithUserId(org.mule.api.MuleEvent muleEvent,
                                                       java.lang.String userId,
                                                       @Default(value="#[message.inboundProperties.\'Authorization\']")
                                                       java.lang.String tokenHeader,
                                                       @Default(value="false")
                                                       boolean claimExtraction)
                                                throws java.lang.Exception
        Uses a internal class to validate the token and the UserID the token was given to. Throws an exception handled by ExceptionHandler if validation fails. If claim extraction is activated, set of id-token claims is added to the flow variables.
        Parameters:
        muleEvent - The current MuleEvent Injected by the devkit
        userId - ID of the user the token was issued to
        tokenHeader - Header with token to be validated ('Bearer TOKEN_STRING')
        claimExtraction - Creates the FlowVar tokenClaims which contains a map with all claims of the given token
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • actAsRelyingParty

        @Processor(intercepting=true)
public java.lang.Object actAsRelyingParty(org.mule.api.callback.SourceCallback callback,
                                                                         org.mule.api.MuleEvent muleEvent,
                                                                         java.lang.String redirectUri,
                                                                         java.lang.String clientId,
                                                                         @Password
                                                                         java.lang.String clientSecret,
                                                                         @Default(value="false")
                                                                         boolean instantRefresh)
                                                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        With this processor the connector works as a relying party specified by the OpenID Connect standard. Token management is realized via the mule object store. Redirects user to the identity provider if there isn't an active session. Otherwise it enhances the request with the Authorization header and continues processing of the current flow.
        Parameters:
        callback - injected by devkit
        muleEvent - injected by devkit
        redirectUri - URI which is registered at the Identity Provider
        clientId - SSO client ID for this application
        clientSecret - SSO client secret for this application
        instantRefresh - Specifies if the tokens are refreshed at every request or only if they expire
        Returns:
        Intercepts the flow if redirecting or process with original content
        Throws:
        java.net.URISyntaxException - If redirect URI isn't valid
        java.lang.Exception
